results.title: The Losses We Share
results.abstract: Perhaps the path to healing begins with three simple words: Are you OK?

results.title: Whatever It Is, It’s Probably Not Hair Dye
results.abstract: Hairdressers weigh in on Rudy Giuliani’s drip problem.

results.adx_keywords: Coronavirus Risks and Safety Concerns;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Cleaning Services;Hygiene and Cleanliness;Hong Kong
results.byline: By Mike Ives and Apoorva Mandavilli
results.title: The Coronavirus Is Airborne Indoors. Why Are We Still Scrubbing Surfaces?
results.abstract: Scientists who initially warned about contaminated surfaces now say that the virus spreads primarily through inhaled droplets, and that there is little to no evidence that deep cleaning mitigates the threat indoors.

media.caption: People buying disinfectant at a shopping mall in Hong Kong.
media.copyright: Lam Yik Fei for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Trump Tax Returns;Income Tax;Tax Evasion;United States Politics and Government;Consultants;Trump, Donald J;Trump, Ivanka;Trump, Eric F (1984- );James, Letitia;Vance, Cyrus R Jr;Cohen, Michael D (1966- );Clifford, Stephanie (1979- );Internal Revenue Service;Trump Organization;Trump, Donald J, Foundation;TTT Consulting LLC
results.byline: By Danny Hakim, Mike McIntire, William K. Rashbaum and Ben Protess
results.title: Trump Tax Write-Offs Are Ensnared in 2 New York Fraud Investigations
results.abstract: Inquiries into the president and his businesses, one criminal and one civil, are now looking at tax deductions taken on consulting fees. Some of the payments appear to have gone to Ivanka Trump.

media.caption: Eric, Ivanka and Donald Trump Jr. with their father at a hotel event in Vancouver, British Columbia. Ms. Trump seems to have been paid as a consultant for the project while also working for the family business.

org_facet: Office of the Director of National Intelligence

media.caption: Janet L. Yellen, the former Federal Reserve chair, will be thrust into negotiating for more aid with what is expected to be a divided Congress.

results.adx_keywords: Art;Sculpture;Deserts;Federal Lands;Bureau of Land Management;Utah
results.title: A Weird Monolith Is Found in the Utah Desert
results.abstract: A team surveying bighorn sheep for Utah’s wildlife agency found the strange object, 10 to 12 feet tall, embedded in the ground in a remote part of Red Rock Country. It’s probably art, officials said.

media.copyright: Utah Department of Public Safety/EPA-EFE, via Shutterstock

results.adx_keywords: Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Vaccination and Immunization;Clinical Trials;Research;Regulation and Deregulation of Industry;AstraZeneca PLC;Oxford University;Food and Drug Administration
results.byline: By Rebecca Robbins and Benjamin Mueller
results.title: After Admitting Mistake, AstraZeneca Faces Difficult Questions About Its Vaccine
results.abstract: Some trial participants only got a partial dose of AstraZeneca’s vaccine. Experts said the company’s spotty disclosures have eroded confidence.

media.caption: AstraZeneca and Oxford “get a poor grade for transparency and rigor when it comes to the vaccine trial results they have reported,” said Natalie Dean, a biostatistician at the University of Florida.
media.copyright: Andrew Testa for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Appointments and Executive Changes;United States International Relations;United States Politics and Government;Presidential Transition (US);Biden, Joseph R Jr;Blinken, Antony J;Obama, Barack;State Department
results.byline: By Lara Jakes, Michael Crowley and David E. Sanger
results.title: Biden Chooses Antony Blinken, Defender of Global Alliances, as Secretary of State
results.abstract: The president-elect is also expected to name Jake Sullivan, another close aide of his, as national security adviser, and Linda Thomas-Greenfield, a 35-year Foreign Service veteran, as his ambassador to the U.N.

media.caption: Antony J. Blinken began his career at the State Department during the Clinton administration.

results.adx_keywords: Presidential Election of 2020;United States Politics and Government;Kushner, Jared;Trump, Ivanka;Trump, Donald J;Washington (DC);Park Avenue (Manhattan, NY)
results.title: As Their D.C. Days Dwindle, Ivanka and Jared Look for a New Beginning
results.abstract: The end of President Trump’s time in office leaves his daughter Ivanka Trump and his son-in-law, Jared Kushner, looking for a new home — but they appear to have plans in New Jersey.

media.caption: Ivanka Trump and Jared Kushner with two of their children in September. The couple found an occasionally awkward reception in Washington, where only 4 percent of residents voted for President Trump in 2016.

results.adx_keywords: Presidential Election of 2020;Presidential Election of 1876;United States Politics and Government;State Legislatures;Electoral College;Absentee Voting;Voter Fraud (Election Fraud);Rumors and Misinformation;Trump, Donald J;Hayes, Rutherford Birchard;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Republican Party;Michigan;Arizona;Georgia
results.title: Trump’s Attempts to Overturn the Election Are Unparalleled in U.S. History
results.abstract: The president’s push to prevent states from certifying electors and get legislators to override voters’ choice eclipses even the bitter 1876 election as an audacious use of brute political force.

media.caption: President Trump’s strategy has become clear over two days of increasingly frenetic action by an executive who is weeks away from losing power.
media.copyright: Anna Moneymaker for The New York Times

results.title: $15,000 Fine After Secret Hasidic Wedding Draws Thousands of Guests
results.abstract: “This was amazingly irresponsible,” Mayor Bill de Blasio said of the event in Williamsburg, Brooklyn.

media.caption: A video of a wedding in Brooklyn circulated widely on the internet, leading city officials to issue a fine.

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Police;Hodges, Honestie;Grand Rapids (Mich)
results.title: Honestie Hodges, Whose Handcuffing Changed Police Policy, Is Dead at 14
results.abstract: Honestie’s handcuffing by the police in Grand Rapids, Mich., caused a national uproar and led to a new law enforcement policy on dealing with youths. Honestie died of Covid-19.

media.caption: Honestie Hodges, in a recent photo.

results.title: Tucker Carlson Dared Question a Trump Lawyer. The Backlash Was Quick.
results.abstract: The president’s allies quickly closed ranks behind Sidney Powell and her pro-Trump conspiracy theory, accusing the Fox host of betrayal.

media.caption: Sidney Powell, an election lawyer for President Trump, has laid out a conspiracy theory that voting machines were hacked and millions of votes were stolen from the president.

results.adx_keywords: Credit and Debt;Federal Aid (US);United States Politics and Government;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Mnuchin, Steven T;Federal Reserve System;Treasury Department
results.byline: By Jeanna Smialek and Alan Rappeport
results.title: Mnuchin to End Key Fed Emergency Programs, Limiting Biden
results.abstract: The Treasury Department asked the Federal Reserve to return unused funds, downsizing the next secretary’s ability to restart the economic support.

media.caption: Steven Mnuchin, the Treasury secretary, at the White House in October. He said he would not extend emergency loan programs that are set to expire at the end of the year.

results.title: No, a Negative Coronavirus Test Does Not Mean You Can Safely Socialize
results.abstract: A negative test is helpful, scientists and doctors say. But it doesn’t mean you should skip other measures, like quarantining, masking and distancing.

media.caption: Lining up for a Covid test in Manhattan this month.
